plurilogues.description: Multi-format English debate with extempore, finals, and block-and-tackle rounds.
rules: Each team gets a word/phrase/term 10 minutes before.
Finals: Four teams, with 2 for and 2 against the motion.
Opening speakers: 2.5 minutes each; second speakers: 1.5 minutes each.
Block-and-Tackle: Switch stances (For/Against/Neutral) on jury cues.

continuum.description: Participants deliver a dialogue on Picasso’s Guernica while creating simultaneous live paintings.
rules: Team of 3 (only one team per school).
Two members present dialogue; all three paint simultaneously.
Only wax crayons and markers allowed.
A3 sheets, easels, chairs, tables provided by host.

quartet.description: Teams perform a short play with 2 historical figures, a concept, and one silent performer.
rules: Only chairs and tables provided; no props or mics.
Silent performer must enhance meaning via gestures.
No special lights/sounds; costumes optional but not judged.

rothko.description: Abstract painting exploration using only one acrylic colour in horizontal and vertical lines.
rules: Theme and mood given 5 minutes before.
Use only A3 sheet and one acrylic colour provided.
Artwork must explore depth, tone, and density of single colour.

illustrations.event_name: Interpretative Illustrations (Ode to Acharya Nandalal Bose)
illustrations.description: Illustration and calligraphy on a page of the Constitution.
rules: Use calligraphy pens, fountain pen, and ink.

quest.description: Written elimination round followed by live multimedia quiz finals.

scriptorium.description: 15-line creative writing blending short story, monologue, and poem.
rules: Must blend 3 genres clearly in 15 lines.

telling.description: Storytelling using object, frame, and music inspired from RBI Ombudsmen storybook.
rules: 1 object + 1 empty frame must be used.
Performance must be collaborative and engaging.

scribe.description: Creative writing tribute to the Constitution with prose and poetry entries.
rules: Theme: A tribute to the Constitution.
Handwritten entries only; A4 sheets provided.

duologues.description: Dialogue performance between one Shakespearean character and one Indian freedom fighter.

sensorium.description: Creative memory presentation using songs, textiles, pioneers, and posters.
rules: 6 minutes presentation including rap/song, textile story, pioneer speech, and posters.

relayart.description: One participant photographs a tree; other paints it as semi-miniature landscape.
rules: Painting: Half A3 sheet with watercolors.

artcritic.description: Critique speech on assigned artwork in 1 hour prep + 1.5 min presentation.
rules: Speech must analyze techniques, motifs, context, and artist background.
Must embody roles: critic, student, aficionado.

sandarbh.description: Choir sings two patriotic songs: one in Hindi, one in another Indian language.
rules: Songs must be pre-1971; Bollywood songs post-1971 not allowed.

movemeant.description: Dance competition with preliminary filmed submission and live finals.
rules: Dance film: 1.5–2 minutes; shot and edited onsite.
Final live performance: 1.5–2 minutes, no soundtrack.
Props allowed: chair, comb, red ribbon.
Costumes: plain T-shirt + pants only; no makeup.
